prompt:
Create a children's picture book in a warm, colorful cartoon style. Each page should have a consistent illustration style, simple shapes, expressive characters, and soft lighting. Include gentle textures, rounded edges, and a bright, friendly color palette suitable for ages 3‚Äì7.
Interactive picture book web page: 10-page story with page navigation, flip animations, and illustrations. Fixed 600x900px layout with gradient styling.
The story should be imaginative, uplifting, and easy to follow, featuring adorable animal characters, positive emotions, and clear visual storytelling. Keep each page uncluttered, with one main scene and minimal but expressive details. Ensure continuity of characters, colors, and environments across all pages. Maintain a soft cartoon look throughout, with high-quality illustrations optimized for children's books. Output: a structured multi-page sequence with page numbers, artwork descriptions for each page, and a flip-page animation transition between them. Please use text-to-image. Image style: Watercolor style, landscape, very soft.

Create a fully functional, user-centric perfume sharing website for the UK and US markets, branded "Dream Perfume," with an Instagram-inspired aesthetic‚Äîminimalist, clean, and highly interactive. The website must feel like a live, usable platform with authentic user-generated content (UGC) and core features that cater to perfume enthusiasts. Below is the detailed requirement:
Brand & Target Audience Brand: Dream Perfume (tone: modern, approachable, luxurious yet relatable) Target Markets: UK & US (language: English; cultural alignment with Western perfume trends, UGC habits, and design preferences)
Core Functional Modules (Must Be Fully Operational) A. Latest Market Perfumes Display a curated feed of newly launched perfumes (2024-2025 releases) from top brands (e.g., Chanel, Dior, Jo Malone, Byredo, Glossier) and emerging indie labels. Each entry includes: Authentic UGC-style images (natural lighting, non-studio shots‚Äîe.g., user holding the bottle, perfume on a vanity, bottle paired with outfits/moody backdrops). Key details: perfume name, brand, launch date, fragrance family (e.g., floral, woody, citrus), top/middle/base notes, and a 1-sentence "vibe summary" (e.g., "Perfect for summer brunch‚Äîbright citrus with a hint of vanilla"). "Save to Wishlist" and "Share" (Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest) buttons. B. Perfume Rankings Categorized leaderboards (visible via a dedicated tab): Top 10 Best-Selling Perfumes (UK/US combined) Most Popular by Fragrance Type (Floral, Woody, Oriental, Fresh) User-Voted "Best of 2024" Each ranking entry includes: rank number, perfume bottle UGC image, brand, total votes/sales data (fictional but realistic, e.g., "50k+ user votes"), and a "See Details" link to the perfume‚Äôs dedicated page. C. User Post Feed (UGC-Centric) A scrollable, Instagram-like feed of user-shared content: Authentic UGC images/videos (no professional studio shots‚Äîfocus on real users‚Äô experiences: e.g., unboxing, perfume layering, bottle collections, scent pairing with occasions). Each post includes: user username (e.g., @perfume_lover_uk), caption (e.g., "Obsessed with Dream Perfume‚Äôs new vanilla musk‚Äîwears so well for date nights! ü´∂"), hashtags (e.g., #DreamPerfume #VanillaMusk #PerfumeGram), and interactive buttons (Like, Comment, Save). Allow users to filter posts by "Trending," "Recent," or fragrance type (via top filter tabs). A prominent "Post Your Perfume" button (sticky at bottom) for users to upload their own content (mock upload interface included for realism).
Design Style (Instagram-Inspired Minimalism) Color Palette: Soft neutrals (off-white, light gray) as base, with subtle accent colors (muted rose gold, soft lavender) for buttons/accents‚Äîno harsh tones. Typography: Modern sans-serif fonts (e.g., Inter, Montserrat) for readability; clean hierarchy (bold headers for sections, light text for captions). Layout: Ample white space, rounded corners for cards/images/buttons, grid-based feed for posts, and a streamlined navigation bar. Interactive Elements: Hover effects (subtle shadow on cards/buttons), smooth scroll animations, and a "load more" button for feeds (no infinite scroll overload). Responsiveness: Fully mobile-friendly (works on smartphones/tablets) with adaptive layouts (feed adjusts to screen size).
Visual Requirements All images must be authentic UGC-style: high-resolution but not over-edited, natural lighting, diverse user scenarios (different skin tones, vanity setups, occasions). Avoid stock photos‚Äîprioritize images that look like they were taken with a smartphone (e.g., slight grain, candid angles, personal touches like jewelry/flowers in the background). Consistent image ratio (1:1 or 4:5) for feed posts to maintain a cohesive Instagram-like look.
Additional Usability Features Navigation Bar: Logo (Dream Perfume) + Tabs (Latest Perfumes, Rankings, Feed) + Search Bar (search by perfume name, brand, or note). Footer: Simple links (About Us, Contact, Privacy Policy, Terms of Service) + Social Media Icons (Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest‚Äîaligned with UGC focus). Wishlist: User-specific section (mock login prompt if needed) to save favorite perfumes. The website should feel lively, trustworthy, and easy to navigate‚Äîlike a go-to community for UK/US perfume lovers to discover new scents, share their finds, and follow trends. Prioritize visual appeal and interactivity to match Instagram‚Äôs engaging vibe while keeping the design clean and not cluttered.

Goal
- Generate a complete Xiaohongshu-style content page (social note page for content + interactions).
- Prioritize mobile-first design with responsive desktop support.
- Output format: choose one (specify clearly for the agent)
  A) Full static HTML file (with Tailwind CSS via CDN + minimal JS)
  B) Single-file React component (default export, using Tailwind classes and lightweight interactivity)
  C) JSON data + rendering template (for SSR or CSR)

Page Structure (MUST include)

1. Header (sticky / non-blocking)
   - Left: back button (clickable)
   - Center: page title or ‚ÄúNote‚Äù
   - Right: menu button (share, report, etc.)

2. Author Block (directly under Header)
   - Circular avatar (48px)
   - Author name (bold), verified badge optional
   - Follow button (toggle state)
   - Publication date (e.g., 2025-12-02)
   - Location tag (optional)

3. Cover Image
   - Responsive hero image
   - Supports srcset
   - Lazy-loading for performance
   - Meaningful alt text

4. Content Section (article)
   - H1 title (max 2 lines)
   - Natural, lifestyle-style text paragraphs (supports line breaks, bold, emoji)
   - Sub-headings (h2/h3)
   - Step list (ol or ul)
   - Inline image grid (1‚Äì6 images) with clickable modal for zooming
   - ‚ÄúKey Takeaways / Tips‚Äù copyable card (3 items, each 8‚Äì15 words)
   - Quote or highlight block optional

5. Interaction Bar (sticky bottom on mobile)
   - Like button (with animation + count)
   - Comment button (with count)
   - Save/Favorite button (toggle)
   - Share button (Web Share API or fallback: copy link)
   - Local state only (no persistence needed)

6. Comments Section (collapsible / lazy-loaded)
   - Show top 2‚Äì3 hot comments first
   - ‚ÄúView more comments‚Äù button loads more
   - Each comment includes avatar, username, time, text

7. Recommended Notes Section
   - 3‚Äì6 cards (horizontal scroll or masonry layout)
   - Each includes thumbnail, title, author name

8. Footer
   - Minimal: copyright, links, brand name

Visual Style & Copywriting Guidelines
- Clean, bright visuals similar to Xiaohongshu.
- Strong focus on photos, white background, soft card shadows.
- Use 1‚Äì2 accent colors (for buttons, tags).
- Typography: system font stack, expressive large titles.
- Tone: personal, first-person, authentic, lifestyle-based storytelling.
- At the end of the note, include a short ‚ÄúConclusion / Tips / CTA‚Äù block:
  - 3 actionable points
  - 8‚Äì15 words each

Tags & Hashtags
- Render 3‚Äì8 topic tags in Xiaohongshu style (#keyword).
- Optional: show heat/engagement count per tag.

Accessibility Requirements (MUST)
- All interactive elements require aria-label.
- Images must have alt text; decorative images use aria-hidden.
- Semantic HTML tags (header, main, article, footer).
- Keyboard support: modal closable with Esc; focus outlines visible.
- Dark mode support via prefers-color-scheme.

Performance Requirements
- Lazy-loading for all non-critical images.
- Preload cover image for fast LCP.
- Optimize DOM order for First Contentful Paint.
- Use SVG icons where possible.
- Avoid blocking JS.

SEO Requirements
- Add meta tags:
  - title
  - description
  - og:title
  - og:description
  - og:image
  - twitter:card
- Add JSON-LD structured data ("@type": "Article"):
  - author
  - datePublished
  - image
  - description
  - keywords

Output Requirements (MUST)
- Include inline comments describing major functional blocks:
  e.g., <!-- AUTHOR BLOCK -->, <!-- IMAGE GRID -->
- Include example placeholder data such as:
  - author name
  - avatar URL (placeholder)
  - 3‚Äì6 images
  - sample hashtags
  - sample descriptive text
- If React output:
  - export default component
  - support props: { data }
- If JSON output:
  - include a strict schema (id, title, author, date, location, cover, images, content, hashtags, likes, comments)
  - include example JSON data

Example Content Requirements (auto-fill when generating):
- Title (max 30 characters)
- Opening paragraph (1‚Äì2 lines)
- 3‚Äì6 body paragraphs (1‚Äì3 lines each, with details)
- 1 step list or tips list
- Closing section with 3 actionable tips

Optional Enhancements (Recommended)
- Blur-up placeholders for images before loading
- Subtle motion/transition effects
- Console.log the input data schema for debugging
- Support both light/dark mode switching

Design a vintage-themed e-commerce homepage for "The Written Word" selling classic stationery (fountain pens, inks, writing papers):
1. Aesthetic: 1920s Art Deco style with dark green, gold, and cream colors, using serif typography
2. Key Features:
  - Product gallery with grid layout and hover "quick view"
  - Storytelling section: "The History Behind Each Item"
  - Monthly "Ink Subscription" showcase
3. Shopping Experience:
  - Slide-out shopping cart
  - "Limited Quantity" badges for collectibles
  - Gift wrapping options
4. Image Generation: Generate 5 high-detail product images of vintage fountain pens and ink bottles on a wooden desk background. Ultra-high definition artistic photography.The placement of objects should adhere to the laws of physics. 
5. Extra: Add micro-interactions (e.g., quill pen animation when adding to cart)
Overall atmosphere: Nostalgic, refined, collectible.Featuring abundant detail and high-end texture.
